result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jacob D Livermore in court with Attorney Kelsey Loshaw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Adam Stuart appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CF1341

Attorney Loshaw requests an adjournment as she is still waiting to hear from probation and parole as to sanction for Defendant. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Drug Treatment Court. Defendant is to be released on 10/29/15 by 9:00 am directly to WCS staff.

Defendant Jacob D Livermore in court, in custody.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. First Drug Treatment Court appearance. Cash bond amended to signature bond on both cases. Defendant is to be released on 10/29/15 by 9:00 am directly to WCS staff.

Defendant Jacob D Livermore in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.

Court adjourns so Defendant's Washington County case can be resolved and Defendant can enter Drug Treatment Court.   Bail remains as fixed.
